subject: Re: Chain tests, and share information accross several tests
msgSnippet: Hello. Thank you Malte, Kent, Cédric and Mark for all you clear, interesting and friendly replies. According to what I ve read, TestNG has _the_ two missing
messageBody:
Hello.

Thank you Malte, Kent, Cédric and Mark for all you clear, interesting and friendly replies.

According to what I've read, TestNG has _the_ two missing features (among other):
* Dependencies
* Parameter

I'm now looking closely at TestNG, since it seems more suitable for our needs. In fact, I would already have adopted TestNG if I was sure it is compatible with the project's environment:
* Maven 1.0.2
* Selenium (latest)
* Hudson (1.349)

Because we test a workflow step by step, almost every test will be dependent of the preceding test. Something like:
[test step 1] --> [test step 2] --> [test step 3] and so on...

AND we will be able to test several workflow branches in parallel, that's interesting.

I will say "Thank you Cedric for creating TestNG" :)

Yves
